name: Quarantaine Mexico (Eng)
description:
I created this project during the first weeks of the covid-19 quarantaine. As the pubs were closed, and my friends missed playing our favorite pub game. I took it on myself to create this (and learn Photon Unity Networking in the process).

RULES:

The goal is to not roll the lowest number or try and roll a 21 a.k.a. "Mexico" . 

You roll 2 dice, the highest number represents the tens number, the lowest the ones. E.g. you roll a 5 and a 4 => 54. 

Rolling the same number on both dice equals the hundredfold. E.g. 3 and 3 => 300.

If a 21 is rolled you are safe from losing and the bet gets doubled (say you start with 2 drinks as a bet it goes up to 4, 8, 16, 32, etc.).

  1. First player rolls up to 3 times. However many times they roll is the max amount of rolls everyone gets for the rest of this round.
  2. Every person aftwerwards rolls until they are satisfied with their result. You can either reroll both dice or a single one. 
  3. The person with the lowest roll loses and has to drink however much the bet is at that point. 
  4. The loser becomes the new first person and the cycle repeats.

If 2 or more people are tied for last they will play round between themselves until there is only 1 loser (the bet can still be increased).
